intro: Canthium zanzibaricum, commonly known as Zanzibar spurge, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of East Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with alternate, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. Canthium zanzibaricum is adapted to coastal and sandy environments, often found in dune ecosystems.
